statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Domantas Sabonis had 21 points and 11 rebounds and Gonzaga moved into a first-place tie in the West Coast Conference with a 92-63 victory over Loyola Marymount on Thursday night.
article.headline: Gonzaga tied for first after 92-63 win over Loyola Marymount
article.linkText: Gonzaga tied for first after 92-63 win over Loyola Marymount
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Domantas Sabonis had 21 points and 11 rebounds and Gonzaga moved into first-place in the West Coast Conference with a 92-63 victory over Loyola Marymount on Thursday night. The Bulldogs (18-5, 10-2) have one more league win than Saint Mary's, which lost at BYU 70-59. Sabonis was 9-of-14 shooting in posting his conference-leading 13th double-double. Kyle Wiltjer was 9 of 13 for 23 points. Gonzaga shot 57 percent, though was only 6 of 21 on 3-pointers. Eric McClellan added 14 points and Kyle Dranginis had 11 points, seven rebounds and seven assists. The Bulldogs outrebounded LMU 40-25 and outscored the Lions in the paint 54-26. Adom Jacko led LMU (10-13, 3-9) with 23 points. Gonzaga shot 63 percent in the first half, including a 14-0 run, to take a 47-26 lead. The Bulldogs' largest lead was 34. The Bulldogs, winners of four straight, haven't lost to LMU since February 2010.
